t: A Maskil of David, when he was in the cave. A Prayer.
With*pn my voice I cry out to the Lord;*s with*ld my voice I plead for mercy to the Lord.*s
I*ln pour out my complaint before him; I*ld tell my trouble before him.
When*pn my spirit faints within me, you*ld know my way! In*ln the path where I walk they*ld have hidden a trap for me.
Look*ln to the right and see: there*ld is none who takes notice of me; no*ln refuge remains to me; no*ld one cares for my soul.
I*pn cry to you, O Lord;*s I*ld say, “You are my refuge, my*ld portion in the land of the living.”
Attend*ln to my cry, for*ld I am brought very low! Deliver*ln me from my persecutors, for*ld they are too strong for me!
Bring*ln me out of prison, that*ld I may give thanks to your name! The*ln righteous will surround me, for*ld you will deal bountifully with me.
